Algorithm.name: ParshallFlume
Algorithm.Comment:
Computes flow through a Parshall Flume according to the width property value assigned to the calculation using this algorithm and the logic:
If width is greater than 9.0 then: Area = 3.6875 * width + 2.5 Flow = Area * (stage ^ 1.6)
If width is less than or equal to 9.0 then: Flow = 4 * width * stage ^ (1.522 * (width ^ 0.026))
Required Properties: width (ie width=7.0 set in computation property)
Required Inputs: stage (observed gauge height)
Output variables: flow (Calculated as determined above)
Programmed by A. Gilmore July 2008;
modified by M. Bogner April 2009 to calculate for widths <= 9.0;
